other uses of solr faceting

published Liquid error: undefined method `strftime' for nil:NilClass

When I was in college, I briefly experimented with solr. As an intern, I hacked together the initial round of search features for twistage, which meant setting up a solr instance, feeding it data, and constructing queries from the frontend. Now, at Etsy I get to work with solr again, and hopefully this time I’ll learn more about its internals. For the moment, however, I want to explore a couple tricks about how solr can be used.

  • Using timestamped queries and facet ranges, you can use your solr instance to construct time series data

TODO : assemble an example dataset. Want timestamps so I can do time series graphs, want some other real bin (like price?) so I can do a not time related bucketing, ideally would like to do geohash range bucketing – and map onto google maps.

For instance, use the EPA dataset.
